free: #e Yes, Ciwkangan is our tribe.
#c 是的，長光是我們的部落。
#e Af for the so-called Ciwkangan Tribe, in the past, (we) would never disobey the chief.
#c 所謂這個長光部落呢，過去而言，絕對不會不聽首領的話。
#e If there was a plague, if people needed to re-cultivate the land, the chief would assign the work to people.
#c 如果有瘟疫，如果要重新耕作，全部由首領支配時間（對於這些工作）。
#e This was also true of praying for rain and the sun.
#c 祈雨、祈太陽，都是如此。
#e There were many taboos in the tribe.
#c 從這個部落（情境）呢，禁忌很多。
#e If someone died, there would be taboos in the tribe.
#c 如果有過世的人家，部落絕對不會沒有禁忌。
#e People couldn’t work then.
#c 不能去工作，從前古老時候是如此。
#e If there was a dought and it didn’t rain, if people needed to pray for rain, the society would pray for rain.
#c 如果乾旱，沒有下雨，如果今天要祈雨的話，部落組織（動員）祈雨。
#n finawlan 是阿美族的社會組織。
#e The society and women’s association would assemble.
#c 聚集部落組織和婦女會。
#n lakacaw是阿美族裡的婦女團體。
#e (They) would go to the sea, tapping the sea water and praying for rain.
#c （他們）到海邊去拍打海水，祈雨。
#e This is how things were done in the past.
#c 從前是這樣做的。
#e From the life of Amis, what the younger generations see and keep abreast of.
#c 所以，從阿美族的生活過程中，我們這一代晚輩所接觸的、所趕上的。
#n ma-ngata=tu  ma-ra’od  ku  ka-ilisin-an：豐年祭快到了。
#e Alas, the offsprings are industrious.
#c 哎呀，（當時）我們這些後代真辛苦。
#e The chief worked hard for the tribal matters.
#c 頭目為了部落的事務而辛苦。
#e There was much tribal work.
#c 關於部落要作的工作很多。
#e There are no subsidies from the government now.
#c （像現在）不知如何，從中央（機關）都沒有補助，什麼也沒有。
#e The youths worked hard in the tribe, logging and picking vines.
#c 現在只有青年全部都在部落辛勞的工作，砍伐、採藤。。
#e That is how the past was.
#c 過去就是這樣。
#n anu han aca 「如果是」
#n anu han aca 「如果是」
#e When the harvest festival comes, next, the society would assemble for seven days to arrange all the tribal activities.
#c 如果到了豐年祭的季節，其次，有七天組織會集合，籌備部落一切活動。
#n ma-la-lakaw泛指部落進行重大活動所需的所有籌備事宜。
#e For example, gathering woods and looking for (pigs) to kill.
#c 例如：集中薪柴，找尋要殺的（豬）。
#e That’s how the tribe was in the past.
#c 過去部落的情形就是如此。
#e Why was the work smooth?
#c 為什麼工作很順利呢？
#n nu作naw，「為什麼」的意思。
#e Why was the thing smooth on that day?
#c 為什麼事情當天都很順利呢？
#e (Because) we had been prepared.
#c （因為）我們早有準備。
#e The chief and the youths had made proper arrangements.
#c 部落裡首領和青年們都策劃完善。
#e Everything was arranged so the work was smooth.
#c 任何事都集中處理，所以工作很順利。
#e The thing was done.
#c 事情就完成了。
#e That’s it.
#c 事情是這樣的。
#e From Amis matters, how do we know worship and God?
#c 所以從阿美族的事務裡，我們怎麼知道這個祭祀跟神的這件事？
#e We know nothing about the ancestors’ God.
#c 我們一點都不知，這個祖先的神。
#e The ritual (by the wizard) means the start of the preparation for worship and other relevant activities.
#c 只有從（這巫師）作法事可看出，就代表開始籌備祭祀的種種事務。
#e During the worship, all the clans would be united.
#c 如果要做祭拜儀式，各氏族（的成員）絕對不會不團結。
#e There are many clans in Ciwkangan.
#c 氏族呢，長光部落很多氏族，這樣子。
#e Each clan would worship.
#c 各氏族都各自祭拜了。
#e That’s it.
#c 所以就是這樣子的。
#e Now, if someone is sick and is to be cast a spell on, people would kill pigs to worship God.
#c 現在呢，如果有人生病而即將要被施法，絕對不會不殺豬，供奉神明。
#e That’s it.
#c 是這樣子的。
#e If someone is sick, there are wizards in Ciwkangan.
#c 如果有人生病，長光部落有巫師。
#e In Ciwkangan, there are more than ten wizards who are in charge of tribal matters.
#c 這個長光部落呢，有十幾位巫師，負責部落的事務。
#e If someone is sick, he would be invited and a spell would be cast on him/her..
#c 如果有人生病，就被邀請去被施法。
#e To cast a spell.
#c 作法。
#e If s/he can be cured, s/he would recover.
#c 如果能（治）好，會好。
#e If s/he is lucky, s/he is lucky.
#c 運氣來的時候，運氣就好。
#e The ancestors were like this.
#c 過去的祖先是這樣子的。
#e None would consult a doctor in the past.
#c 至於醫生呢，過去都沒有人給醫生看。
#e All depend on spells.
#c 全部都靠施法。
#e All the clans were united.
#c 各氏族團結一致。
#e From the so-called worship, (they were) united.
#c 從每個儀式都是一樣的。
#e That’s it.
#c 是那樣。
#e Next, it is cultivation season now. There is a drought; it doens’t rain.
#c 其次呢，現在農忙時期，非常乾旱，沒有下雨。
#e The society would be mobilized.
#c 部落大動員。
#n l<um>awad 表「起身」。
#e The chiefs (of the clans) would assemble.
#c 集合(氏族的)首領。
#e The youths would come to Xiuguluan River, here at Makuta’ay, the so-called Moon Well.
#c 年齡層最低的青少年（們）來秀姑巒溪，在大港口這裡，那個月洞（月井）。
#e There is the so-called Moon Well below; (so we) pray for rain there.
#c 在下面，有那個所謂的月洞，所以從那個月洞來祈雨。
#e If they were lucky, it would rain.
#c 如果運氣好，要下雨的話，就會下雨。
#e The past is like this.
#c 過去是這樣子的。
#e If many people in the tribe were sick or had a fever, or any disease, the fathers of the youths would be called.
#c 如果部落有很多人生病，發燒感冒的，任何疾病，青年之父這輩就被招喚。
#e We carried out epidemic prevention.
#c 我們現在實施防疫。
#n 防疫也是透過「驅魔」的儀式達成。
#e The youths picked vines before breakfast.
#c 年輕一輩呢，早飯前去摘藤。
#n mi-lidafak特別指「早飯前」的工作。
#e The youths picked Aledu (some kind of plant).
#c 年齡層最小的青年去摘aledu（某植物）。
#e They gathered after breakfast.
#c 早餐後就集合了。
#e Spells were casting from door to door.
#c 那個呢，挨家挨戶的作法。
#n sitatatata指的是施法時唸咒的狀聲詞。
#e The corners of every house were tapped.
#c 拍打每家每戶的牆角。
#e To expel the demons, the so-called ‘akuma’.
#c 趕走那些惡魔，也就是日本所說的akuma這樣。
#e That is how the ancestors expeled the demons.
#c 如此，祖先過去驅魔。
#e That’s it.
#c 就是那樣。
#e As for what the elders mean by ‘kalalakw’ is to build houses.
#c 過去老人家所說的kalalakaw就是蓋房子（「分家」）之意。
#e All the things were taken care of by the youths and their fathers.
#c 全部由青年輩到青年之父（部落組織）負責。
#n 年齡層涵蓋14~42歲。
#e Planning the houses for those would like to divide up family property.
#c 計畫分家的人所住的房子。
#e If people want to pick vines, they have to set out today and stay overnight at Cifutingay.
#c 如果要摘藤，今天就要出發，在水姆丁過夜。
#e They came back on the second day.
#c 第二天就回來了。
#n ta-tusa在此為誤用。
#e The elders then processed the vines.
#c 老人家把藤加工。
#e After it was done, it is sufficient to build a house, (so they) built a house.
#c 加工完之後，足夠蓋房子，就蓋房子了。
#e The youths built houses.
#c 由部落青年從事蓋房子的任務。
#e People would not build houses on their own.
#c 不會私自蓋自己的房子。
#e In the past, when building houses, people helped each other like this.
#c 過去是這樣，在蓋房子的時候，互相幫忙。
#e It is different now.
#c 在現在來說現在的時代大大的不同了。
#e Everything depends on money now.
#c 全部都是用錢。
#e That is what I want to say about the past.
#c 我所要敘述的過去事務就是那樣。
#e That is what I want to say.
#c 這就是我所要講的。
